CODIF_DATA.AA_AUTHORITY_TYPE: Ministry or any other national or federal authority
CODIF_DATA.PR_PROC: Negotiated without a prior call for competition

ML_AA_NAMES.AA_NAME: Ministry of Defence, DSG, Defence Support Group (DSG)

ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY.OFFICIALNAME: Ministry of Defence, DSG, Defence Support Group (DSG)

TITLE.P: The Supply of C2A2 Sight Spares and Associated Items

SHORT_DESCR.P: Optical instruments. Babcock DSG Ltd, which is acting as the agent for the UK Ministry of Defence known as the authority, is considering a 2-year Contract with 3 x 1 year options as a framework agreement with a single operator to supply spares and associated items for the C2A2 Sight Unit.

Babcock DSG Ltd, which is acting as the agent for the for the UK Ministry of Defence known as the authority, is considering 2-year with 3 x 1 year options a single operator framework agreement to supply spares and associated items for the C2A2 Sight Unit. All items within scope are codified to NATO Stock Numbers (NSNs). The compliant Manufacturer Part Numbers (MPNs) are detailed on the Codification Support Information System (CSIS) maintained by the United Kingdom National Codification Bureau, further details can be found on the CSIS/UKNCB website.

The authority reserves the right to amend the framework agreement to include further in scope items, which are not materially different in character and so not substantially change the terms of the framework agreement, post contract award.
Any resulting contract shall contain a set of key performance indicators to measure performance in areas such as transparency, delivery and quality, and shall include remedies for poor performance.

D_JUSTIFICATION.P: Babcock DSG Ltd, acting as agent for the UK Ministry of Defence, intends to negotiate a Contract with Hall and Watts Defence Optics Ltd for the supply of C2A2 Sight Spares.

It is considered that this contract can be awarded using the negotiated procedure without prior publication pursuant to Regulation 16(1)(a)(i) of the Defence and Security Public Contracts Regulations 2011 (the ‘Regulations’) (Article 28(1)(e) of Directive 2009/81/EC) due to the absence of suitable tenders received in response to a call for competition (reference 2019/S 146-360833) under the ‘restricted’ procedure set out in Regulation 17 of the Regulations.
This notice is for information only and not a request for expressions of interest, so please do not apply to be invited to tender.

TITLE.P: Supply of C2A2 Sight Spares and Associated Items

ADDRESS_CONTRACTOR.ADDRESS: Unit A3 Merlin Centre, Acrewood Way

INFO_ADD.P: The authority reserves the right to amend any condition related to security of information to reflect any changes in national law or government policy. If any contract documents are accompanied by instructions on safeguarding classified information (e.g. a Security Aspects Letter), the authority reserves the right to amend the terms of these instructions to reflect any changes in national law or government policy, whether in respect of the applicable protective marking scheme, specific protective markings given, the aspects to which any protective marking applies, or otherwise. The link below to the Gov.uk website provides information on the Government Security Classification.

Advertising Regime OJEU: this contract opportunity is published in the Official Journal of the European Union (OJEU), the MoD Defence Contracts Bulletin and www.contracts.mod.uk GO Reference: GO-2020213-DCB-15989184
